title: Organization Type Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of organization types within The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each organization type (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

corporation.description: A business entity focused primarily on commercial interests and profit generation.

government.description: An official governing body with administrative authority over a region or population.

military.description: Armed forces organized for combat, defense, or security operations.

intelligence_agency.description: Organization specializing in gathering and analyzing information, often secretly.

criminal_syndicate.description: Group engaged in illegal activities, typically with a structured hierarchy and profit motive.

resistance_group.description: Organization opposing an established power through various means including protest, sabotage, or armed struggle.

religious_order.description: Community united by spiritual beliefs, practices, and/or traditions.

research_institution.description: Organization dedicated to scientific, technological, or academic investigation and discovery.

megacorp.description: Massive corporate entity with influence and power equivalent to or exceeding that of governments.

non_profit.description: Organization pursuing social, cultural, or humanitarian goals without profit distribution to members.

secret_society.description: Covert group with hidden membership, rituals, and objectives, often seeking to influence events from the shadows.

mercenary_group.description: Professional fighters who sell their military services to the highest bidder.

political_party.description: Organization that seeks to influence government policy or gain political power through electoral processes.

guild.description: Association of professionals, craftspeople, or merchants that regulates practices and standards in their field.

tribe.description: Social group connected by kinship, shared traditions, and often territory, typically with distinct cultural identity.

community.description: Group united by common interests, location, or purpose, usually with informal structure and collective decision-making.

cult.description: Group characterized by unusual beliefs, extreme devotion to a figure or idea, and often isolation from mainstream society.

activist_group.description: Organization focused on advocating for specific social, political, or environmental changes.

media_outlet.description: Entity that distributes news, entertainment, or information through various channels.

terrorist_organization.description: Group using violence and intimidation against civilians to achieve political, religious, or ideological objectives.

international_body.description: Organization composed of multiple member states or entities for coordinated governance or cooperation on specific issues.

clan.description: Group united by actual or perceived family ties with shared traditions and often territories.

school.description: Institution focused on education, training, or the transmission of specialized knowledge.

family_dynasty.description: Extended family with significant power, wealth, or influence maintained across multiple generations.

social_club.description: Organization formed primarily for social interaction, recreation, or mutual support among members.

hacker_collective.description: Group of computer specialists who collaborate on digital activities, often with political or social objectives.

categoryMapping.description: Grouping of organization types by category (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

commercial.description: Organizations primarily driven by economic interests.

governmental.description: Organizations with official political authority or seeking such authority.

illicit.description: Organizations operating outside legal frameworks for profit or ideological reasons.

community_based.description: Organizations based on shared identity, territory, or interpersonal connections.

ideological.description: Organizations united by shared beliefs, values, or objectives.

specialized.description: Organizations with specific professional, expertise-based, or niche functions.
